# Maintainers

This file lists the maintainers responsible for the long-term health, security,
and direction of this project.

Maintainers are trusted stewards of the codebase and community. They enforce
project policies, code quality, security practices, and guide contributors.

---

## ğŸ‘‘ Lead Maintainer (BDFL / Project Lead)

| Name  | Role | Responsibilities |
|-------|------|------------------|
| Dhruv13x | Founder & Lead Maintainer | Final technical & security authority, release approvals, governance decisions |

The Lead Maintainer has ultimate oversight and veto authority in case of conflict
or security risk, following the governance model.

---

## ğŸ§  Current Maintainers

> Maintainers have merge rights, release rights, and security disclosure access.

| Name | GitHub | Responsibility Areas | Status |
|------|--------|----------------------|--------|
| Dhruv13x | https://github.com/dhruv13x | Core architecture, releases, security, CI/CD, roadmap | Active |

_No additional maintainers at this time._

---

## ğŸ›  Responsibilities

Maintainers are responsible for:

- Reviewing & merging PRs
- Ensuring code quality & style consistency
- Enforcing contribution and security policies
- Managing release pipelines
- Responding to security disclosures
- Guiding new contributors
- Upholding the Code of Conduct
- Making roadmap & architectural decisions

Security patches & vulnerabilities **must be prioritized** above feature development.

---

## â­ Becoming a Maintainer

Maintainers are selected based on:

- History of meaningful contributions
- Code quality & review excellence
- Security awareness & responsible behavior
- Positive mentorship & community engagement
- Technical understanding of core components

### Nomination Process
1. Maintainer or lead proposes candidate
2. Public discussion (GitHub Discussion / Issue)
3. Approval by Lead Maintainer
4. Access granted + entry added to this file

---

## âŒ Removing a Maintainer

Removal may occur for:

- Code of Conduct violations
- Security negligence
- Inactivity for > 6 months
- Hostility or toxic behavior
- Intentional harm or sabotage

Decision made via Governance rules.

---

## ğŸ” Security Contacts

Security vulnerabilities must be reported privately.

ğŸ“§ **security@<project-domain-or-gmail>**  
(Replace if project-specific alias exists)

See **SECURITY.md** for full disclosure process.

## ğŸ§¾ Notes

- Maintainers act in good faith for project benefit
- Voting/decision models defined in `GOVERNANCE.md`
- This file is updated when new maintainers join or depart

---

## â¤ï¸ Acknowledgements

This maintaining model is inspired by governance standards from:

- CNCF / Linux Foundation Open Governance
- PyPA & Python PEP-style maintainership rules
- OpenSSF security best practices

We welcome future maintainers as the project and ecosystem grow!
